info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 2 at 9:10PM MST until July 3 at 12:15AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa.
* WHEN...Until 1215 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hassayampa River, Star Wash, Wagner Wash, Jimmie Wash, Little San Domingo Wash, Mill Wash, Trilby Wash, Winters Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Monarch Wash, Ox Wash, San Domingo Wash, Tub Spring Wash and Daggs Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckeye and Morristown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MST THURSDAY
